DrugInfoMetaData.DrugInfoDescription: Datopotamab deruxtecan-dlnk is a type of targeted therapy drug called an antibodyâ€“drug conjugate. It consists of a monoclonal antibody linked to a toxic drug called deruxtecan that binds to a protein on the surface of some cancer cells. The linked drug enters these cancer cells and blocks an enzyme called topoisomerase I. This damages the DNA of the cancer cells and kills them.

Section.Title: Use in Cancer
Section.Para: Datopotamab deruxtecan-dlnk is approved to treat:

ItemizedList.ListItem: Breast cancer that is hormone receptor positive (HR+) and HER2 negative (HER2-). It is used in adults who have received hormone therapy and chemotherapy for cancer that has spread or cannot be removed by surgery.

Section.Para: Datopotamab deruxtecan-dlnk is also being studied in the treatment of other types of cancer.
